New Records: Chicago White Sox averted a record-breaking loss for the third straight day.
Chris Flexen was winless in his previous 23 starts, a franchise record.
Los Angeles Angels set a franchise record for losses in a season with 96 losses.
Los Angeles Angels finished with the most road losses for the team since 1996.
Key Match Events: Chris Flexen struck out seven in 6 1/3 innings for his first win since May 8.
Andrew Vaughn hit a two-run single in the fifth inning.
Lenyn Sosa doubled home two more runs in the fifth inning.
Zach Neto departed due to right shoulder irritation after trying to steal second base.
Post-Match Reflections: Andrew Vaughn expressed satisfaction with the team's performance over the last three games.
Interim manager Grady Sizemore highlighted the excitement and competitive spirit of the team.
Chris Flexen appreciated the crowd's ovation after his performance.
Logan O’Hoppe reflected on the disappointing season for the Angels.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chicago White Sox finished their home schedule with a 23-58 record.
The Angels managed just five runs and 19 hits in the series at Chicago.
The White Sox put the game away with a season-high seven runs in the fifth inning.
Others: Angels' 1B Nolan Schanuel got the day off after fouling a ball off his right leg in the previous game.
Upcoming matchups: Angels' Reid Detmers vs. Texas' Jacob deGrom, White Sox's Garrett Crochet vs. Detroit.
